meanings.definition: The activity or profession of promoting a person or organization, especially through publicity.
meanings.sent1: In the world of flackery, public relations specialists work hard to boost their clients' images.
meanings.sent2: The company's success was largely due to the skilled flackery of their marketing team.
meanings.sent3: The flackery surrounding the new product launch was so over-the-top that it made people skeptical.
meanings.sent4: Her flackery was like a magician's sleight of hand, creating illusions of grandeur.
meanings.sent5: The flackery at the event was so dazzling that it overshadowed the actual product being promoted.

meanings.definition: The exaggerated or insincere praise used to promote someone or something.
meanings.sent1: His flackery of the mediocre film made it sound like a masterpiece.
meanings.sent2: She saw through the flackery and recognized the true value of the product.
meanings.sent3: The flackery from the salesperson was so transparent that it made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The flackery surrounding the celebrity's new book was like a thick fog, obscuring its actual quality.
meanings.sent5: The politician's flackery was so over-the-top that it became a running joke among voters.
